segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and today we've got a very special lesson for you all about time.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们有一节关于时间的特别课程。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We're going to concentrate a little bit on some specific points of grammar this time, and we're going to talk about the morning routine, what you do in the mornings.
segments.cn: 这次我们将专注于一些特定的语法点，并讨论早晨的日常活动。

segments.en: Well, let's take a look first at the word routine.
segments.cn: 首先，让我们看看“日常”这个词。

segments.en: This is our vocabulary preview for today.
segments.cn: 这是我们今天的词汇预览。

segments.en: Vocabulary Preview Alright, so a routine, or the morning routine.
segments.cn: 词汇预览 好的，日常，或者说早晨的日常。

segments.en: What is a routine?
segments.cn: 什么是日常？

segments.en: A routine is basically your habit for a certain period of time.
segments.cn: 日常基本上是你在某段时间内的习惯。

segments.en: So, for example, your routine in the morning is what you do when you wake up, get breakfast, and go to work.
segments.cn: 例如，你早上的日常是你醒来、吃早餐和上班时所做的事情。

segments.en: You can also have an evening routine.
segments.cn: 你也可以有一个晚间日常。

segments.en: It's what you always do before you go to bed.
segments.cn: 这是你在上床睡觉前总是做的事情。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, everyone has a routine, what they do in the mornings, maybe what you do at night before going to bed.
segments.cn: 所以，每个人都有自己的日常，早上做的事情，或者晚上上床前做的事情。

segments.en: So, that's what we're going to talk about today.
segments.cn: 这就是我们今天要讨论的内容。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: You can also have an exercise routine.
segments.cn: 你也可以有一个锻炼日常。

segments.en: So, basically anything with steps.
segments.cn: 基本上，任何有步骤的事情。

segments.en: One, two, three, four, five, that you always do the same way.
segments.cn: 一、二、三、四、五，总是以相同的方式进行。

segments.en: That's the routine.
segments.cn: 这就是日常。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, that's what we're going to take a look at today.
segments.cn: 所以，这就是我们今天要看的内容。

segments.en: Why don't we jump right into our dialogue and listen to Stephanie's routine.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不直接进入对话，听听Stephanie的日常。

segments.en: Stephanie, did you just get to school?
segments.cn: Stephanie，你刚到学校吗？

segments.en: But you were up and about when I left the dorm this morning.
segments.cn: 但我早上离开宿舍时你已经在忙了。

segments.en: That was about an hour and a half ago.
segments.cn: 那是大约一个半小时前。

segments.en: This happens all the time.
segments.cn: 这种情况经常发生。

segments.en: Why do you always take so long to get ready in the mornings?
segments.cn: 你为什么早上总是花这么长时间准备？

segments.en: It's a skill.
segments.cn: 这是一种技能。

segments.en: What can I say?
segments.cn: 我能说什么呢？

segments.en: I don't know why.
segments.cn: 我不知道为什么。

segments.en: I just have a long routine.
segments.cn: 我只是有一个很长的日常。

segments.en: Please explain because it makes no sense to me.
segments.cn: 请解释一下，因为我完全不理解。

segments.en: How can a girl's routine be so complicated?
segments.cn: 女孩的日常怎么会这么复杂？

segments.en: You get up, you shower, you get dressed, you brush your teeth, you're out the door.
segments.cn: 你起床，洗澡，穿衣服，刷牙，出门。

segments.en: Half an hour tops.
segments.cn: 最多半小时。

segments.en: Jacob, you have the luxury of having a haircut that rarely needs styling.
segments.cn: Jacob，你有一个几乎不需要打理的发型的奢侈。

segments.en: I don't.
segments.cn: 我没有。

segments.en: I have to set aside about an hour and a half to get ready in the mornings.
segments.cn: 我早上需要留出大约一个半小时来准备。

segments.en: Every day, I wake up and head straight for the shower.
segments.cn: 每天，我醒来后直接去洗澡。

segments.en: Every second day, I wash my hair.
segments.cn: 每隔一天，我洗一次头。

segments.en: If it's a hair washing day, I frequently need to wash my hair twice because it gets really oily.
segments.cn: 如果是洗头的日子，我通常需要洗两次，因为头发会变得很油。

segments.en: Then, I usually put in a conditioner and have to rinse that out too.
segments.cn: 然后，我通常会涂上护发素，还得冲洗掉。

segments.en: Because my hair is so long, I seldom manage to take a shower in under 20 minutes.
segments.cn: 因为我的头发很长，我很少能在20分钟内洗完澡。

segments.en: Afterwards, I often put on a pot of coffee and get dressed while I wait for it to brew.
segments.cn: 之后，我通常会煮一壶咖啡，同时穿衣服，等它煮好。

segments.en: I take a long time to get dressed in the morning.
segments.cn: 我早上穿衣服花的时间很长。

segments.en: Every now and then, I remember to choose my outfit the night before, but usually, I do it in the morning.
segments.cn: 偶尔我会记得前一天晚上选择好衣服，但通常是在早上做的。

segments.en: In all, getting dressed takes about half an hour, at which time my hair is now semi-dry, so then I have to style my hair.
segments.cn: 总的来说，穿衣服大约需要半小时，这时我的头发已经半干了，所以我得打理头发。

segments.en: From time to time, I'll put my hair up, but oftentimes, I blow dry it straight.
segments.cn: 有时我会把头发扎起来，但通常我会把它吹直。

segments.en: And then, because of the texture of my hair, I regularly have to flat iron it to keep it from frizzing.
segments.cn: 然后，由于我头发的质地，我经常需要用平板夹来防止毛躁。

segments.en: That's another 20 minutes or so.
segments.cn: 这又要花大约20分钟。

segments.en: After that, I have my daily makeup routine.
segments.cn: 之后，我有我的日常化妆程序。

segments.en: True.
segments.cn: 确实。

segments.en: I hardly ever see you without your hair done and your makeup on, even when you show up to class in sweat pants.
segments.cn: 我几乎从不见你不打理头发和化妆，即使你穿着运动裤来上课。

segments.en: Tell me, how long does it take you to choose that outfit in the morning?
segments.cn: 告诉我，早上选择那套衣服要花多长时间？

segments.en: Not funny.
segments.cn: 不好笑。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So obviously, she has a very complicated routine.
segments.cn: 显然，她的日常非常复杂。

segments.en: I don't know if all girls are like this.
segments.cn: 我不知道所有女孩都是这样吗。

segments.en: I'm not like this, but I think a lot of girls, and some guys are.
segments.cn: 我不是这样，但我认为很多女孩，甚至一些男孩是。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: I don't want to be sexist here.
segments.cn: 我不想性别歧视。

segments.en: I know some guys who take their time in the morning and are very, very particular about the way that they look.
segments.cn: 我知道一些男孩早上也很花时间，对自己的外表非常讲究。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: Well, yeah, I imagine everyone has their morning routine in different ways, and it was interesting to see how she described it.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，我想每个人的早晨日常都不一样，看到她的描述很有趣。

segments.en: So, why don't we take a look at language takeaway?
segments.cn: 那么，我们来看看语言要点吧。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: So, today's language takeaway, like I said at the beginning of the podcast, is all about time.
segments.cn: 所以，今天的语言要点，正如我在播客开始时所说，都是关于时间的。

segments.en: So, we're going to look at some of these important time adverbs.
segments.cn: 所以，我们将看看一些重要的时间副词。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: These are called adverbs of frequency, and basically, they are telling us how we do things.
segments.cn: 这些被称为频率副词，基本上是告诉我们我们做事情的频率。

segments.en: If we do something all the time, or if we never do something.
segments.cn: 如果我们总是做某事，或者从不做某事。

segments.en: Or everything in between.
segments.cn: 或者介于两者之间的所有情况。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, the first couple we have today are very, very common words.
segments.cn: 所以，今天我们有的前几个是非常常见的词。

segments.en: You're going to hear these a lot.
segments.cn: 你会经常听到这些。

segments.en: The first one is frequently.
segments.cn: 第一个是“经常”。

segments.en: Okay, frequently.
segments.cn: 好的，频繁。

segments.en: So, if you do something frequently, consider it to be about 75% of the time.
segments.cn: 所以，如果你经常做某事，可以认为是大约75%的时间。

segments.en: Maybe a little bit more, almost 85% of the time.
segments.cn: 也许稍微多一点，几乎85%的时间。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, it's not always, but it's very often.
segments.cn: 所以，这不是总是，但很常见。

segments.en: So, for example, so, I frequently forget to take my keys when I'm leaving the house, which is a very big problem.
segments.cn: 例如，我经常忘记在离开家时带上钥匙，这个问题很大。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, considering out of seven days, maybe you forget your keys five days.
segments.cn: 所以，考虑到七天中，也许你有五天忘记了钥匙。

segments.en: Not so good.
segments.cn: 这可不好。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So, that's frequently.
segments.cn: 所以，这就是“经常”。

segments.en: Now, let's move on to another one that's actually a lot less.
segments.cn: 现在，让我们继续另一个实际上少得多的。

segments.en: We talk about seldom.
segments.cn: 我们谈谈“很少”。

segments.en: Well, Marco has told me that he seldom forgets his keys.
segments.cn: 嗯，Marco告诉我他很少忘记钥匙。

segments.en: That means he almost always remembers them.
segments.cn: 这意味着他几乎总是记得。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, seldom is a negative adverb.
segments.cn: 所以，“很少”是一个否定副词。

segments.en: It's saying that almost never.
segments.cn: 它表示几乎从不。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, if I say, for example, I seldom go to the movies.
segments.cn: 所以，如果我说，例如，我很少去看电影。

segments.en: That's too bad.
segments.cn: 真可惜。

segments.en: I like the movies.
segments.cn: 我喜欢看电影。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Well, that means that I maybe go to the movie theater once a month.
segments.cn: 那么，我可能每个月去一次电影院。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Not very often.
segments.cn: 不太常去。

segments.en: Seldom.
segments.cn: 很少。

segments.en: Not very often.
segments.cn: 不太常去。

segments.en: Seldom.
segments.cn: 很少。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Now, going back to a positive adverb of frequency, we have often.
segments.cn: 现在，回到一个积极的频率副词，我们有“经常”。

segments.en: You described frequently as very often.
segments.cn: 你把“频繁”描述为“非常经常”。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, I could also say, I often forget my keys.
segments.cn: 所以，我也可以说，我经常忘记我的钥匙。

segments.en: Or, it often rains in tropical places.
segments.cn: 或者，热带地区经常下雨。

segments.en: This means this is a common thing.
segments.cn: 这意味着这是一个常见的事情。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, again, let's consider it to be about 70 to 80 percent of the time.
segments.cn: 所以，再次考虑一下，大约70%到80%的时间。

segments.en: Now, with pronunciation, some people like to pronounce often, right?
segments.cn: 现在，在发音方面，有些人喜欢发音“often”，对吧？

segments.en: They kind of leave out the strong T sound, while other people say often.
segments.cn: 他们有点省略了强烈的T音，而其他人则说“often”。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Both forms are correct, right?
segments.cn: 两种形式都是正确的，对吧？

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: They're both correct.
segments.cn: 它们都是正确的。

segments.en: So, you're safe using either of these.
segments.cn: 所以，使用这两种都没问题。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And our fourth adverb of frequency is also a positive one, and we say usually.
segments.cn: 我们的第四个频率副词也是一个积极的，我们说“通常”。

segments.en: Usually means this is something that you do pretty consistently.
segments.cn: “通常”意味着这是你做得相当一致的事情。

segments.en: I usually brush my hair before I go to sleep.
segments.cn: 我通常在睡觉前梳理头发。

segments.en: That means not always, but almost every day.
segments.cn: 这意味着不是每次，但几乎每天。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, let's consider that of seven days, you do it six times.
segments.cn: 所以，假设在七天中，你做六次。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: I usually do this.
segments.cn: 我通常这样做。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, usually is, again, very, very common.
segments.cn: 所以，“通常”是非常非常常见的。

segments.en: And something in between, maybe 60 percent of the time, 50 percent of the time, we say regularly.
segments.cn: 而在两者之间，可能60%的时间，50%的时间，我们说“定期”。

segments.en: Well, I think of the word regularly as being very closely related to regular.
segments.cn: 我认为“定期”这个词与“规律”非常相关。

segments.en: So, basically, if I have a schedule, I do the same thing every day.
segments.cn: 所以，基本上，如果我有一个日程，我每天做同样的事情。

segments.en: I do it regularly.
segments.cn: 我是定期做的。

segments.en: But sometimes there's a special occasion.
segments.cn: 但有时会有特殊的场合。

segments.en: For example, I regularly run five kilometers after work when I go to the gym.
segments.cn: 例如，我在下班后去健身房时，定期跑五公里。

segments.en: But sometimes when I want to go out with my friends, I don't run.
segments.cn: 但有时当我想和朋友出去时，我就不跑。

segments.en: So, it's not always, but it is pretty regular.
segments.cn: 所以，这不是每次，但确实相当规律。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, regularly means you do it very often, but there are some exceptions.
segments.cn: 所以，“定期”意味着你做得非常频繁，但有一些例外。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Now, those are our adverbs of frequency, but we have a couple of other phrases that are very similar.
segments.cn: 现在，这些是我们的频率副词，但我们还有几个非常相似的短语。

segments.en: So, we want to take a look at those as well.
segments.cn: 所以，我们也想看看这些。

segments.en: Let's go back to the beginning of Stephanie's routine when she said that every day I wake up.
segments.cn: 让我们回到斯蒂芬妮的日常生活开始时，她说每天我都醒来。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, every day means 100 percent of the time every single day.
segments.cn: 所以，每天意味着100%的时间，每一天。

segments.en: Monday to Sunday.
segments.cn: 从周一到周日。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, obviously, you wake up every day.
segments.cn: 所以，显然，你每天都醒来。

segments.en: Or I brush my teeth twice every day.
segments.cn: 或者我每天刷两次牙。

segments.en: So, that's 100 percent of the time.
segments.cn: 所以，这就是100%的时间。

segments.en: Now, if we say every second day, what does that mean?
segments.cn: 现在，如果我们说“每隔一天”，那是什么意思？

segments.en: That means Monday yes, Tuesday no, Wednesday yes, Thursday no, or any day.
segments.cn: 那意味着周一是，周二不是，周三是，周四不是，或任何一天。

segments.en: So, basically, she says I wash my hair every second day.
segments.cn: 所以，基本上，她说我每隔一天洗一次头。

segments.en: That means one day I wash my hair, but the next day I don't.
segments.cn: 这意味着一天我洗头，第二天我不洗。

segments.en: The day after that, though, I wash it again.
segments.cn: 但接下来的一天，我又洗一次。

segments.en: Every second day.
segments.cn: 每隔一天。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, you can say every second day, and I think you can also say every other day.
segments.cn: 所以，你可以说每隔一天，我认为你也可以说“每其他一天”。

segments.en: Every other day.
segments.cn: 每其他一天。

segments.en: So, every other day or every second day.
segments.cn: 所以，每其他一天或每隔一天。

segments.en: He calls his mother every other day.
segments.cn: 他每隔一天给母亲打电话。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And she also said that every now and then I remember to choose my outfit.
segments.cn: 她还说，每隔一段时间我记得选择我的服装。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Well, this one's interesting.
segments.cn: 这个有趣。

segments.en: This is not very frequent.
segments.cn: 这不是很频繁。

segments.en: This is basically saying sometimes.
segments.cn: 这基本上是在说有时。

segments.en: Sometimes.
segments.cn: 有时。

segments.en: So, now and then.
segments.cn: 所以，偶尔。

segments.en: Every now and then means I sometimes do it, I sometimes don't do it.
segments.cn: 每隔一段时间意味着我有时这样做，有时不这样做。

segments.en: Every now and then I really want to eat chocolate, so I buy a candy bar.
segments.cn: 每隔一段时间我真的想吃巧克力，所以我买了一块糖。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, maybe you want to eat chocolate twice in a month.
segments.cn: 所以，也许你一个月想吃巧克力两次。

segments.en: Yeah, not very often.
segments.cn: 是的，不太常见。

segments.en: Not very often.
segments.cn: 不太常见。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And another one that's very similar is from time to time.
segments.cn: 另一个非常相似的是“时不时”。

segments.en: So, Marco said that he doesn't go to the movies very frequently, so he goes from time to time.
segments.cn: 所以，马尔科说他不经常去看电影，所以他时不时去。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, I can say, I seldom go to the movies or I can say, I like to go to the movies from time to time.
segments.cn: 所以，我可以说，我很少去看电影，或者我可以说，我喜欢时不时去看电影。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Or this girl is describing her appearance.
segments.cn: 或者这个女孩在描述她的外貌。

segments.en: She says, from time to time I put my hair up.
segments.cn: 她说，时不时我会把头发扎起来。

segments.en: So, that means most of the time.
segments.cn: 所以，这意味着大部分时间。

segments.en: That means sometimes it's down, sometimes it's up.
segments.cn: 这意味着有时是放下的，有时是扎起来的。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, as you can see, there are many different ways of describing the frequency or how many times you do certain actions or your routine, right?
segments.cn: 所以，正如你所看到的，有很多不同的方式来描述频率或你做某些动作或日常的次数，对吧？

segments.en: So, you can use this with a lot of things when you're describing.
segments.cn: 所以，当你描述时，你可以用很多东西。

segments.en: And we encourage you to try some of these new ones because a lot of English learners use the same time adverbs whenever they speak.
segments.cn: 我们鼓励你尝试一些新的，因为很多英语学习者在说话时使用相同的时间副词。

segments.en: So, try and really use some of these and challenge yourself.
segments.cn: 所以，尝试并真正使用一些这些，挑战自己。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, that's all we have for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以，这就是我们语言学习的要点。

segments.en: Why don't we move on now to fluency builder?
segments.cn: 我们现在为什么不继续进行流利度训练呢？

segments.en: Fluency builder.
segments.cn: 流利度训练。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, using some of these adverbs, I could say, I can say, I regularly make a pot of coffee in the morning.
segments.cn: 所以，使用一些这些副词，我可以说，我每天早上定期煮一壶咖啡。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, a pot of coffee.
segments.cn: 所以，一壶咖啡。

segments.en: You regularly make a pot of coffee.
segments.cn: 你定期煮一壶咖啡。

segments.en: That means you like to drink coffee every day.
segments.cn: 这意味着你每天都喜欢喝咖啡。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: I always need my cup of coffee in the morning.
segments.cn: 我早上总是需要我的一杯咖啡。

segments.en: So, I usually make it first thing.
segments.cn: 所以，我通常第一件事就是煮咖啡。

segments.en: So, a pot of coffee, we know what a cup of coffee is, but a pot of coffee, what is a pot?
segments.cn: 所以，一壶咖啡，我们知道一杯咖啡是什么，但一壶咖啡，什么是一壶？

segments.en: A pot is basically the container that you use when you brew coffee, when you make it.
segments.cn: 一壶基本上是你在冲泡咖啡时使用的容器。

segments.en: So, you put the coffee beans in the machine, and instead of having a cup underneath, you have a bigger container that's a pot.
segments.cn: 所以，你把咖啡豆放进机器里，而不是在下面放一杯，而是有一个更大的容器，就是一壶。

segments.en: You can also have a pot of tea.
segments.cn: 你也可以有一壶茶。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: It's many cups, usually eight or ten cups.
segments.cn: 通常是八到十杯。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And remember that verb, to brew coffee.
segments.cn: 记住那个动词，冲泡咖啡。

segments.en: I think it's a very nice kind of fancy way of saying making coffee.
segments.cn: 我觉得这是一个很好的说法，意味着制作咖啡。

segments.en: Brew a pot of coffee.
segments.cn: 冲泡一壶咖啡。

segments.en: I'm brewing some coffee.
segments.cn: 我正在冲泡咖啡。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, apart from coffee and all of these things, let's take a look at some of the specific phrases that she used when she was talking about her hair, because I think her hair is very complicated.
segments.cn: 除了咖啡和这些东西，让我们看看她在谈论她的头发时使用的一些具体短语，因为我觉得她的头发很复杂。

segments.en: It is very complicated.
segments.cn: 确实很复杂。

segments.en: Sometimes she washes her hair, sometimes she doesn't wash her hair, sometimes she blow dries it straight.
segments.cn: 有时她洗头，有时不洗，有时她把头发吹直。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, to blow dry means that you use a blow dryer.
segments.cn: 所以，吹干意味着你使用吹风机。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: This is a machine that uses electricity to blow hot air on your hair so that your hair will dry quickly.
segments.cn: 这是一种使用电力将热空气吹到你头发上的机器，以便你的头发能快速干燥。

segments.en: But you can blow dry your hair in many ways.
segments.cn: 但你可以用很多方式吹干头发。

segments.en: Some people have curly hair, and they have special tools for making their hair curly.
segments.cn: 有些人有卷发，他们有特殊的工具来让头发卷曲。

segments.en: But she says she blow dries it straight.
segments.cn: 但她说她把头发吹直。

segments.en: That means she makes it straight with the hot air.
segments.cn: 这意味着她用热空气把头发弄直。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, I think the way you do this is you take the blow dryer and a brush, and you brush while you blow dry, right?
segments.cn: 所以，我认为你这样做的方法是你拿着吹风机和一把刷子，同时吹干和刷头发，对吧？

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Making lines.
segments.cn: 制造线条。

segments.en: See, I know a little bit about this.
segments.cn: 看，我对这个有一点了解。

segments.en: Even though I don't have long enough hair for this.
segments.cn: 尽管我没有足够长的头发。

segments.en: No, I guess... Well, maybe you are secretly one of those guys who has a routine like this woman.
segments.cn: 不，我想... 好吧，也许你秘密地是那种有像这个女人一样的日常的人。

segments.en: I don't think I can take this much time in the shower and brushing my hair.
segments.cn: 我觉得我不能在洗澡和梳头发上花这么多时间。

segments.en: But moving on, actually, I also know this next phrase.
segments.cn: 但继续，实际上，我也知道下一个短语。

segments.en: To flat iron your hair.
segments.cn: 拉直头发。

segments.en: Okay, so flat iron is a noun and a verb.
segments.cn: 好的，所以拉直是名词也是动词。

segments.en: So I use a flat iron or I can flat iron my hair.
segments.cn: 所以我使用拉直器，或者我可以拉直我的头发。

segments.en: This is a tool that we use that's very, very hot.
segments.cn: 这是我们使用的一个非常非常热的工具。

segments.en: Think of an iron.
segments.cn: 想想熨斗。

segments.en: It's very, very hot.
segments.cn: 它非常非常热。

segments.en: And it basically presses my hair and makes it very, very, very thin and flat and straight.
segments.cn: 它基本上压平我的头发，使其非常非常薄、平坦和直。

segments.en: Right, so I think people that have straight hair don't need to really flat iron their hair.
segments.cn: 对，所以我认为有直发的人不需要真的拉直他们的头发。

segments.en: Nah, but if you have very curly hair, then you need it.
segments.cn: 不，但如果你有非常卷曲的头发，那你就需要。

segments.en: So what's the difference?
segments.cn: 那么有什么区别？

segments.en: Give us the insight here.
segments.cn: 给我们一些见解。

segments.en: Why wouldn't you just blow dry it straight?
segments.cn: 为什么你不直接吹干它？

segments.en: Why do you need to flat iron it?
segments.cn: 为什么你需要拉直它？

segments.en: Because a flat iron makes it more flat.
segments.cn: 因为拉直器使它更平。

segments.en: It makes your hair stick together more and it's much, much, much hotter than a blow dryer.
segments.cn: 它使你的头发更紧密，温度比吹风机高得多。

segments.en: Okay, so I guess if you use a blow dryer, then you have puffy hair.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我想如果你使用吹风机，你的头发就会蓬松。

segments.en: Or like the next word that she described, frizzy hair.
segments.cn: 或者像她描述的下一个词，毛躁的头发。

segments.en: Okay, so the adjective to describe this kind of hair is frizzy.
segments.cn: 好的，所以形容这种头发的形容词是毛躁的。

segments.en: For example, when it's very rainy, my hair is frizzy.
segments.cn: 例如，当天气非常潮湿时，我的头发是毛躁的。

segments.en: That means that it sticks out.
segments.cn: 这意味着它会翘起来。

segments.en: It's very thick and not straight.
segments.cn: 它非常厚，不直。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: It's not curly, but it's, you know, it's messy.
segments.cn: 它不是卷曲的，但它是，嗯，有点乱。

segments.en: It kind of inflates.
segments.cn: 它有点膨胀。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: It's like a little balloon.
segments.cn: 就像一个小气球。

segments.en: But the verb here is to frizz.
segments.cn: 但这里的动词是毛躁。

segments.en: So my hair is frizzing.
segments.cn: 所以我的头发在毛躁。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And that means that it's getting like this, bigger or inflated.
segments.cn: 这意味着它变得像这样，更大或膨胀。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So usually girls who have this problem have it worse during very humid or rainy days.
segments.cn: 所以通常有这个问题的女孩在非常潮湿或下雨的日子里会更严重。

segments.en: Not so bad when it's dry.
segments.cn: 干燥时就没那么糟。

segments.en: Okay, so I actually have a little bit of frizzy hair.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我实际上有一点毛躁的头发。

segments.en: That's why I have to use some sort of hair gel or mousse.
segments.cn: 这就是为什么我必须使用某种发胶或摩丝。

segments.en: See, it's not because I'm vain.
segments.cn: 看，这不是因为我爱美。

segments.en: It's just because if I don't use this, I'll come in looking like a lion.
segments.cn: 只是因为如果我不使用这个，我会像狮子一样出现。

segments.en: And I don't think... I think I might have to insist that that happens sometime soon.
segments.cn: 我觉得... 我想我可能得坚持一下，看看什么时候会发生。

segments.en: We can take a picture and put it on our website Englishbot.com.
segments.cn: 我们可以拍张照片放在我们的网站 Englishbot.com 上。

segments.en: For sure, for sure.
segments.cn: 当然，当然。

segments.en: All right, so why don't we go back and listen to the dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们为什么不回去再听一次对话。

segments.en: Stephanie, did you just get to school?
segments.cn: 斯蒂芬妮，你刚到学校吗？

segments.en: But you were up and about when I left the dorm this morning.
segments.cn: 但你早上我离开宿舍时已经在外面了。

segments.en: That was about an hour and a half ago.
segments.cn: 那大约是一个半小时前。

segments.en: This happens all the time.
segments.cn: 这种情况经常发生。

segments.en: Why do you always take so long to get ready in the mornings?
segments.cn: 你为什么总是花这么长时间准备？

segments.en: It's a skill.
segments.cn: 这是一种技能。

segments.en: What can I say?
segments.cn: 我能说什么呢？

segments.en: I don't know why.
segments.cn: 我不知道为什么。

segments.en: I just have a long routine.
segments.cn: 我只是有一个很长的日常。

segments.en: Please explain because it makes no sense to me.
segments.cn: 请解释一下，因为我觉得这没有意义。

segments.en: How can a girl's routine be so complicated?
segments.cn: 女孩的日常怎么会这么复杂？

segments.en: You get up, you shower, you get dressed, you brush your teeth, you're out the door.
segments.cn: 你起床，洗澡，穿衣服，刷牙，出门。

segments.en: Half an hour tops.
segments.cn: 最多半小时。

segments.en: Jacob, you have the luxury of having a haircut that rarely needs styling.
segments.cn: 雅各布，你有一个几乎不需要打理的发型。

segments.en: I don't.
segments.cn: 我没有。

segments.en: I have to set aside about an hour and a half to get ready in the mornings.
segments.cn: 我早上需要留出大约一个半小时来准备。

segments.en: Every day, I wake up and head straight for the shower.
segments.cn: 每天，我醒来后直接去洗澡。

segments.en: Every second day, I wash my hair.
segments.cn: 每隔一天，我洗一次头发。

segments.en: If it's a hair washing day, I frequently need to wash my hair twice because it gets really oily.
segments.cn: 如果是洗头的日子，我通常需要洗两次，因为头发会很油。

segments.en: Then I usually put in a conditioner and have to rinse that out too.
segments.cn: 然后我通常会用护发素，还得冲洗掉。

segments.en: Because my hair is so long, I seldom manage to take a shower in under 20 minutes.
segments.cn: 因为我的头发很长，我很少能在20分钟内洗完澡。

segments.en: Afterwards, I often put on a pot of coffee and get dressed while I wait for it to brew.
segments.cn: 之后，我通常会煮一壶咖啡，同时穿衣服，等咖啡煮好。

segments.en: I take a long time to get dressed in the morning.
segments.cn: 我早上穿衣服花的时间很长。

segments.en: Every now and then I remember to choose my outfit the night before, but usually I do it in the morning.
segments.cn: 偶尔我会记得前一天晚上选择好衣服，但通常是在早上。

segments.en: In all, getting dressed takes about half an hour, at which time my hair is now semi-dry, so then I have to style my hair.
segments.cn: 总的来说，穿衣服大约需要半小时，这时我的头发已经半干了，所以我还得打理头发。

segments.en: From time to time, I'll put my hair up, but oftentimes I blow dry it straight.
segments.cn: 有时我会把头发扎起来，但通常我会把它吹直。

segments.en: And then, because of the texture of my hair, I regularly have to flat iron it to keep it from frizzing.
segments.cn: 然后，由于我头发的质地，我经常需要用平板夹来防止毛躁。

segments.en: That's another 20 minutes or so.
segments.cn: 这又要花20分钟左右。

segments.en: After that, I have my daily makeup routine.
segments.cn: 之后，我有我的日常化妆程序。

segments.en: True, I hardly ever see you without your hair done and your makeup on, even when you show up to class in sweatpants.
segments.cn: 说实话，我几乎从不见你不打理头发和化妆，即使你穿着运动裤来上课。

segments.en: Tell me, how long does it take you to choose that outfit in the morning?
segments.cn: 告诉我，早上选择那套衣服需要多长时间？

segments.en: Not funny.
segments.cn: 不好笑。

segments.en: Alright, so actually talking about morning routines, and we've given you so many tools, I think it would be a great idea if our users came to our site, EnglishPod.com, and posted a part of their morning routine, trying to use as many adverbs of frequency as possible.
segments.cn: 好吧，实际上谈谈早晨的日常，我们给了你这么多工具，我觉得如果我们的用户来我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，发布他们的一部分早晨日常，尽量使用尽可能多的频率副词，会是个好主意。

segments.en: That's a great suggestion, and to get you all started, I could give you a little bit of my routine.
segments.cn: 这是个好建议，为了让大家开始，我可以给你一点我的日常。

segments.en: Alright, let's hear it.
segments.cn: 好吧，听听。

segments.en: Every morning when I wake up, I turn off the alarm, which is very loud, and I take a shower.
segments.cn: 每天早上我醒来时，我关掉很大的闹钟，然后去洗澡。

segments.en: I always brush my teeth, and I usually brew a pot of coffee, although sometimes I don't have time to brew my coffee, and I wait until I arrive at my office.
segments.cn: 我总是刷牙，通常会煮一壶咖啡，虽然有时我没有时间煮咖啡，就等到到达办公室再喝。

segments.en: I seldom choose the clothes I will wear the night before.
segments.cn: 我很少在前一天晚上选择要穿的衣服。

segments.en: I almost always choose them in the morning, and generally I ride my bike to work, but not always.
segments.cn: 我几乎总是在早上选择，通常我骑自行车上班，但并不总是。

segments.en: Okay, I think in the winter you seldom ride your bike to work.
segments.cn: 好吧，我觉得冬天你很少骑自行车上班。

segments.en: Every once in a while I would.
segments.cn: 偶尔我会。

segments.en: Every now and then.
segments.cn: 有时。

segments.en: Alright, see?
segments.cn: 好吧，看到没？

segments.en: You have a perfect example there of more or less what we expect, but also it would be interesting to see if you have any other type of routine.
segments.cn: 你有一个完美的例子，基本上是我们所期待的，但如果你有其他类型的日常也会很有趣。

segments.en: I know some people wake up in the morning, and the first thing they do, they always walk their dog, for example.
segments.cn: 我知道有些人早上醒来，第一件事就是总是遛狗，比如说。

segments.en: Oh, that's very nice.
segments.cn: 哦，那很好。

segments.en: Other people are very hungry, so they almost always eat right when they wake up.
segments.cn: 其他人很饿，所以他们几乎总是在醒来时吃东西。

segments.en: I eat before I brush my teeth.
segments.cn: 我在刷牙之前吃东西。

segments.en: Smart, actually.
segments.cn: 其实很聪明。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Alright, so we want to hear from you guys.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们想听听你们的。

segments.en: Come to EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 来到EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: We'll see everyone there.
segments.cn: 我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
